description: A woman is tied up with rope in a garden while a man holding a stake stands over her, seemingly unconcerned with her predicament. The focus of the scene is shifted from the tied-up woman to a discussion about garden pests. This creates an absurd situation where the presence of aphids is treated with more urgency than a person being bound. The sharp irony lies in the contrast between the extreme human situation and the mundane, albeit intense, concern over garden health.
caption: "Aphids! Aphids, Henry! ... Aphids are loose in the garden!"
